ThingDef.Name: DankPyon_WineBase
ThingDef.label: wine
ThingDef.description: Liquor of many faces. Old vintages are dainty drinks intended for connoisseurs and rather finicky tongues - mandatory positions at royal parties, feasts and masquerades. Younger are often sold to peasants in roadside inns, diluted with water as much as innkeepers conscience allows.

ThingDef.Name: DankPyon_MustWineBase
ThingDef.label: grape must
ThingDef.description: Crushed grapes. Needs to undergo fermentation in a rustic fermenting barrel in order to become wine.

ThingDef.label: mulberry wine
ThingDef.description: Produced from the luscious bounty of mulberry orchards, often associated with the mulberry tree's role in nurturing silk worms. Aged vintages whisper tales of sophistication, beckoning connoisseurs with their intricate flavors, a staple of esteemed gatherings and royal banquets.

ThingDef.label: mulberry wine must
ThingDef.description: Crushed mulberries. Needs to undergo fermentation in a rustic fermenting barrel in order to become wine.

ThingDef.label: ice wine
ThingDef.description: Crafted from the rare frostberries, is a sought-after elixir known for its enchanting qualities. The frostberries, harvested during the first winter's frost, yield a wine with a crisp, sweet flavor and a hint of winter's chill. Ice Wine imparts a subtle frost resistance to those who drink it, fortifying them against the harshest cold. This magical beverage is a favorite among adventurers and travelers braving icy terrains, offering both warmth and protection in a single, refreshing sip.
